text: Hamelin Town 's in Brunswick , By famous Hanover city
the people in a body To the Town Hall
black rats , grey rats , tawny rats
Their cellar 's biggest butt with Rhenish
a wandering fellow With a gipsy coat of red and yellow
the folks to shrink From the duty of giving you something to drink , And a matter of money to put in your poke
a bustling Of merry crowds justling at pitching and hustling
girls , With rosy cheeks and flaxen curls , And sparkling eyes and teeth like pearls . Tripping and skipping , ran merrily after The wonderful music with shouting and laughter
The place of the children 's last retreat
any one playing on pipe or tabor
a mighty band Out of Hamelin town in Brunswick land
